abstract: Alain E Kaloyeros, founding president and chief executive of State University of New York Polytechnic Institute, has resigned from boards of nonprofit management corporations Fort Schuyler and Fuller Road, which both manage private-public partnerships in state, in order to avoid appearance of conflict of interest; Kaloyeros has been instrumental in Gov Andrew M Cuomo's efforts to stimulate economic growth in upstate cities.
lead_paragraph: Alain Kaloyeros, president of the State University of New York Polytechnic Institute, resigned from the boards of two groups that seek to revive upstate cities.

headline.main: A Key Player in Cuomo’s Economic Revival Plans Quits Two Nonprofits
headline.print_headline: Vital Player in Reviving Upstate Cities Quits Boards

snippet: Alain Kaloyeros, president of the State University of New York Polytechnic Institute, resigned from the boards of two groups that seek to revive upstate cities.
